page.title: 10Dairy Farming 1.
page.content: This is a large dairy farm of 180acres The farmhouse is only about 50 years old and stands beside the River Hanny.Mr.Ball's great grandfather rented the land and bought it in 1930,adding Elsworthy land in 1970 and 2,9acre fields at Cowbridge in 1978.He has a herd of 200 Friesian cows and is building up a pedigree herd to be known as the Hannaford Herd registered with the British Friesian Society.He milks three times a day.The cows give 28-30litres of milk a day immediately after calving and go down to as little as 10 prior to calving.Of the 180acres he uses70 for maize ,70 for grass silage and 40 for pasture.No hay is made and the cows are fed on a mixture of maize,silage and molasses all mixed in a large machine.It costs Mr.Ball Â£600p.a. to feed a cow.
